intro: Myosotis forsteri, commonly known as the New Zealand forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded areas such as forests and stream margins. It has a compact growth habit and produces showy, clustered blooms throughout the spring and summer. Myosotis forsteri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
